titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The Woman's Club of Germantown was founded in 1917 as an organization to participate in the social, civic, educational, and philanthropic life of Germantown and the surrounding community. The Club meetings were held in the Johnson House, an historic building in Germantown which was once a stop on the Underground Railroad . The Junior Section of the Women's Club was organized in 1920. Activities of the Club included: luncheons and other social events; antiques, flower, and fashion shows; supporting community causes, such as a local boy's chorus and the Cancer Society; various forms of war work, including sewing and knitting; and cultural tours.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the records of the Woman's Club of Germantown from its inception in 1917 to the mid 1970s. Records include: meeting minutes of the Executive Board; records of the Welfare Committee and Junior Section; financial records, such as ledgers and check registers; club histories and annual reports; programs of activities; records of the annual antiques show; printed Club constitution and by-laws; membership lists. The collection includes numerous scrapbooks of photographs, clippings, programs, and announcements.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
